reviews.text: The Hotel De Verbier is situated in the centre of town & is convenient for all the local bars, clubs & shops. There is a bus stop 30 yards down the road where the frequent free buses will take you to the Medran cable car.
reviews.title: Good central location

likes.disliked: — The area around the front of the hotel can be a little noisy in the early hours of the morning

reviews.text: The hotel is clean & tidy with reasonably sized rooms & en suite bathrooms. The beds were comfortable & the linen was fresh & clean.
reviews.title: Only 1 or 2 niggles

reviews.text: The staff were very good, polite & helpful. The dining room staff were efficient, breakfast is a little basic but the evening meals were well presented, varied & of a good quality.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings
This hotel is brilliant!
reviews.text: The Inghams reps were excellent showing good knowledge of the resort & facilities whilst being very helpful.

reviews.title: Value Gem in Verbier
reviews.text: The Hotel is run as a Chalet Hotel by Inghams. I was struggling to find acommodation I thought was good value in what appears to be an over priced resort

reviews.title: Very good hotel accomodation, central location, fantastic hosts
reviews.text: The hotel exceeded my expecations with excellent staff, good food and a comfy room. The hotel is positioned in the cente of Verbier (Place Centrale) and so is close to all amenities and consequently a little noisy. I used ear plugs as I am a light sleeper and had a week of excellent sleep.

reviews.title: nice hotel ,
reviews.text: The hotel runs a fixed memu - which is varied and of good quality. The veggie option appeared good too, though I didn't sample that. The hotel took my nut allergy seriously and I was informed of any nut related issues as they occured.

reviews.title: Fantastic Staff
reviews.text: The free wine served with dinner was pretty nice and the bar good value for Verbier. The ski bus was nearby and it was about 2 mins from the Medran lifts on the way and about 10 mins on the way back round the road system

reviews.title: An excellent base, friendly staff and wonderful varied food.
reviews.text: The room was large and has good large beds. The toilet and bathroom was en suite, small but perfectly acceptable and clean with a good shower and plenty of hot water

reviews.title: Everything we expected and better
reviews.text: The hotel is being run by Inghams as a Club/Chalet hotel, so travelling mid December we knew that this would be their first week in the season with a new team. Having done this before, you expect a few glitches, but the price generally reflects that. But I have got to say the service and food were excellent. Quite a young team, but everybody was very keen and eager to please. The food and wine were good and plentiful.

reviews.title: Cheap Bar
reviews.text: The hotel itself is one of the oldest in Verbier, so our room and bathroom were fairly basic, but they had everything we needed. There was only one very small thing which let it down, and that was the boot room which wasn't heated enough, so boots were still damp in the morning.

reviews.title: great location for party animals - beware otherwise
reviews.text: The Hotel is right in the centre of the town, so I could imagine it could get noisy in the season, but it is ideally situated. The ski bus stops on the road just below the hotel, but the main lift is only a 5 minute walk in ski boots.

reviews.title: Great Staff - Busy Location
reviews.text: We had a fantastic holiday here.

reviews.title: lovely hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at an Inghams chalet and went to the bar here for a quiz night. The drinks were cheap and atmosphere was good. Located on the central roundabout in town, it's easy enough to move onto other places as the night moves on.
Stayed here in Feb 2012 as part of an Ingham package ski holiday.
reviews.title: Not 4*

reviews.text: Advertised as a 4*, but most definitely not. Its is a nice hotel, just a bit dated and in need of a refurb, especially in the bedrooms. We had room 33, which we were advised had a sloping roof, but some clever cloggs decided to put the bath on the sloping wall so you can't actually stand up to have a shower.
reviews.title: Verbier March 2012 - Last minute booking

reviews.text: Food is distinctly average and really not good for a vegetarian.
reviews.title: Central Hotel with great staff

reviews.text: Location wise - brilliant. Right in the heart of the village and opposite the Farinet (great bar/nightclub). The ski bus stop is only a couple of minutes walk away.
reviews.title: jaded furnishing, excellent position, helpful staff

reviews.text: I booked this hotel only 3 days before travelling for a party of 4 boarders/skiers so got a very good deal for Verbier. The staff were exceptional, attentive,informative & a very happy group. Inghams have a great team at this hotel. So yes this is a catered Inghams chalet so no issues for the the linguistically challenged. The Breakfast was great with porridge & hot options avaialable along the continental option. Evening meals were of a very high standard & the staff were not shy with the complimentary wine throughout the meal.
reviews.title: a lovely stay Great staff
